newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: N.Korean infiltrators were shot, Seoul says.
newsitem.headline: N.Korean infiltrators were shot, Seoul says.

text.p: Eleven North Korean infiltrators found dead on Wednesday had been shot, probably by one of their number who then turned the gun on himself, a South Korean defence ministry spokesman said.
A twelfth member of the infiltration squad has been captured alive and another eight or nine are still at large, the spokesman told a news conference.
"One of the dead infiltrators had a gun on him and we think he killed himself after shooting the others," the spokesman said.
He said authorities now believed a total of around 20 infiltrators had been put ashore on Wednesday by a submarine on the east coast of the Korean peninsula just south of the border with North Korea.
"We're now searching for eight to nine infiltrators still at large," he said.
Earlier, authorities said about 10 North Koreans had sneaked on to a beach. Police and troops have launched a massive air-and-sea search.
